TITLE.P: Market Dialogue — Invitation to one-to-one meetings — Procurement of fleet management and leasing

SHORT_DESCR.P: Statens vegvesen [the Norwegian Public Roads Administration] extends an invitation to market dialogue through one to one meetings with service providers of administration of vehicle fleets and leasing.

The Norwegian Public Roads Administration will enter into agreements with 1 tenderer who will be responsible for the combined administration of the Norwegian Public Roads Administration’s vehicle fleet, both leased and owned vehicles. The Contracting Authority will switch to leasing as a general rule in regard to financing of vehicles, with an option to purchase vehicles when appropriate.

Statens vegvesen [the Norwegian Public Roads Administration] extends an invitation to market dialogue through one-to-one meetings with service providers of administration of vehicle fleets and leasing.

The Norwegian Public Roads Administration will enter into agreements with 1 tenderer who will be responsible for the combined administration of the Norwegian Public Roads Administration’s vehicle fleet, both leased and owned vehicles. The Contracting Authority will switch to leasing as a general rule in regard to financing of vehicles, with an option to purchase vehicles when appropriate.

Altogether the Norwegian Public Roads Administration has a vehicle fleet of around 1 200 vehicles and 100 motorcycles. Currently the Norwegian Public Roads Administration purchases and owns all vehicles.

The Norwegian Public Roads Administration needs to either lease or purchase vehicles for different purposes in relation to our sector responsibility. We want to enter into an agreement with 1 tenderer, who in addition to covering our need for vehicles, also contributes to the most optimal and cost efficient administration of the vehicle fleet.

For several years, the Contracting Authority has purchased vehicles, so leasing is a relatively new concept for the Norwegian Public Roads Administration. We want to have a discussion with the market to obtain input to the tender documentation so that both we and the market have an unified vision of what shall be procured and how the assignment can be implemented. Therefore we are inviting service providers who can provide input in this phase to attend one-to-one meetings.
See the attached document for a more detailed description of the Norwegian Public Roads Administration’s need in this area.

INFO_ADD.P: Service providers who want to participate in one to one meetings are requested to sent an email to andre.kempe@vegvesen.no by 8.3.2018, 12:00. 1 hour will be aside per service provider for dialogue during week 11. The meetings will be held at Vegdirektoratet [the Directorate of Public Roads], Brynsengfaret 6A Oslo.
During the market dialogue phase we will also accept written input. The deadline to submit written input is 19.3.2018, 12:00.
